student_answer: The Fourier Transform converts a time-domain signal into its frequency components, helping analyze spectral characteristics and system behavior.
Fourier transform is used to change signals into frequency domain representation.
In the active region of a BJT, the base-emitter junction is forward biased and the collector-base junction is reverse biased.
A BJT works by amplifying current when the emitter and base junction conducts.
Feedback improves system stability and reduces steady-state error in control systems.
Feedback is used to control the output of a system.
Amplitude modulation varies the amplitude of the carrier signal according to the message signal.
In AM, the carrier amplitude changes based on the information signal.
A universal gate is a logic gate, such as NAND or NOR, that can be used to implement any other Boolean function without requiring any other gate types.
A universal gate is a logic gate like NAND or NOR that is universal because it can build every other type of gate on its own.
